field.name: summary
field.value: No apparent way to get Castle.Facilities.Logging.dll from NuGet Packages

field.name: description
field.value: Installed Castle Windsor, Core, and Core NLog but none of them brought down Castle.Facilities.Logging.dll. Unless there was another package that I missed I think this is an issue.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I think that's more of a question to whoever is maintaining the nuget packages for Castle. Who does that?

comment.author: cromwellryan
comment.text: What version of Castle are pulling down? Can you post the package.config of the problem project? Also, try creating a clean project and doing install-package Castle.Windsor-NLog. Asking for that just to confirm it's not a "my machine" problem with the package. Here's what I did http://screencast.com/t/EbLJDgaXM

comment.author: Greg.Roberts
comment.text: My project originally had the castle windsor project installed and then I later added the nLog package. Here is my package file: <packages> <package id="Castle.Core" version="2.5.2" /> <package id="Castle.Windsor" version="2.5.2" /> <package id="NLog" version="2.0.0.0" /> <package id="Castle.Core-NLog" version="2.5.2" /> </packages>

comment.author: Greg.Roberts
comment.text: My project originally had the castle windsor project installed and then I later added the nLog package. Here is my package file: <packages> <package id="Castle.Core" version="2.5.2" /> <package id="Castle.Windsor" version="2.5.2" /> <package id="NLog" version="2.0.0.0" /> <package id="Castle.Core-NLog" version="2.5.2" /> </packages>

comment.author: Greg.Roberts
comment.text: I figure it out, it's the difference from Install-Package Castle.Windsor-NLog and Install-Package Castle.Core-NLog

comment.author: cromwellryan
comment.text:
Cool. Just to confirm you did something liked this:
install-package Castle.Core install-package Castle.Windsor install-package Castle.Core-NLog
?
For those who find this, Castle.Windsor-NLog has the facility for NLog.
